newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany to meet EMU goals, consolidate -Waigel.
newsitem.headline: Germany to meet EMU goals, consolidate -Waigel.

text.p: Germany will fulfil the convergence criteria for participation in European monetary union (EMU) this year, though much budget consolidation is still needed, Finance Minister Theo Waigel said on Friday.
The EMU criteria will determine the participants, and no prospective participant has a guaranteed entry, he said.
Germany is well aware of its responsibility under the planned single currency, Waigel said, according to the text of a speech prepared for delivery at a construction industry conference.
"We want to, and will, fulfil the criteria," he said.

German media say the spring report by the company's six leading economic research institutes, due on Tuesday, will forecast a public-sector budget deficit of 3.2 percent for 1997, above the three percent threshold for EMU participation.
